name: Rising Angels
description: Rising Angel's mission is to bring sex trade education to professionals and the public, and to provide supportive services and safe environments to women exploited by the sex trade, allowing them to experience physical, mental, social and spiritual restoration in their lives.

name: Regeneration Outreach
description: Regeneration is a caring community that continually strives to provide dignity for those in need, as an expression of Christian love in action. They serve those living in extreme poverty and homelessness by meeting their physical and spiritual needs.

name: Dismas Fellowship Brampton
description: Dismas Fellowship provides a safe community to worship for persons with a history of offence.

name: Brantford Blessing Centre
description: The Brantford Blessing Centre provides access to food for marginalized communities. We make and serve meals twice a month and assist with additional projects as they come up.

name: Friendship House
description: Friendship House is a drop-in centre that works to support the physical, emotional, and spiritual needs of guests. We support them primarily by donating to their food bank.

name: Hope Boxes
description: Oxford-Brant Hope Box is bringing hope and healing to families experiencing pregnancy and infant loss. These free faith-based boxes are a practical, tangible outreach to our community and a way to bring hope and care during a challenging time.

name: Next Door Social Space
description: Next Door is a community resource centre in the Aldershot area. We offer support through fundraisers, volunteering for events, and helping to run outreach programs like their Monday night ball hockey league.

name: Bethany Residence
description: Bethany Residence provides accommodation and care for individuals in need or at risk. We visit and develop relationships with residents and provide Christmas gifts.

name: Crossroads Prison Ministries Canada
description: Crossroads Prison Ministries cultivates Christ-centred relationships between those inside and outside prison walls. Many at our site volunteer as mentors for students and we actively promote their year-round fundraisers.

name: 541 Eatery & Exchange
description: 541 is a community café that offers nutritious and affordable food. We have teams volunteering in the kitchen and supporting their pay-it-forward button program.

name: Indwell
description: Indwell creates affordable housing communities that support health, wellness, and belonging. We offer prayer support for residents and staff, and we build relationships through participating in Tea Time with residents.

name: Mission Services
description: Mission Services is a social services agency. We partner with them by running weekly food collections, volunteering once a month at their food bank, and providing additional support during the holidays by distributing Holiday Hampers.

name: TrueCity
description: TrueCity is a network of Hamilton churches. We contribute to their Christmas hampers which support families in need, and we provide regular donations to The Giving Closet, a not-for-profit thrift store in Crown Point neighbourhood.

name: Indwell
description: Indwell creates affordable housing communities that support health, wellness, and belonging. We support them by running recreational and social events for tenants at various buildings — this has included board-game afternoons, cookie-decorating events, and spring gardening days to help care for the grounds.

name: 541 Eatery & Exchange
description: 541 is a community café that makes nutritious and affordable food accessible to patrons in need through a button donation system. We volunteer there regularly and support the space by hosting creative workshops and events.

name: The Baby Depot
description: The Baby Depot helps families in need with children 0–2 years old. We donate clothes and other essential items, fold and organize clothes at their facility, and help wash and pack bins for delivery.

name: Crossroads Prison Ministries Canada
description: Crossroads Prison Ministries cultivates Christ-centred relationships between those inside and outside prison walls. We offer financial support and mentorship for students through their Bible study courses.

name: Helping Hands Street Mission
description: Helping Hands Street Mission works to aid people living in the Barton Street Community. We come along side HHSM by providing support for programs to guarantee their continuation and success through volunteering and donations.

name: Ray of Hope
description: Ray of Hope supports the disadvantaged, marginalized, and troubled through youth employment and addiction services and other community support programs. We support them financially and through collecting food items to distribute through their Community Centre.

name: Life Centre Guelph
description: The Life Centre is a downtown mission in Guelph, Ontario that provides a safe and loving environment for anyone who is in need. Each week they provide up to 600 meals, and a variety of programs at no charge.

name: Dismas Fellowship London
description: To provide a safe and welcoming place where people who have been incarcerated and were friends can experience Christian community.

name: New Life Prison Ministries
description: New Life Prison Ministries offers hope and direction to those impacted through the criminal justice system by presenting the good news of Jesus Christ through Bible correspondence studies, prison chapel services, visitation, video showings and aftercare support so that God's name may be honoured and glorified.

name: Youth For Christ
description: Following Jesus' mission, YFC engages with youth in London by building relationships, developing potential and exploring faith - in partnership with the community and local churches.

name: Rose of Sharon
description: Rose of Sharon is dedicated to providing counselling, education and parenting resources to prenatal and parenting young mothers and their families throughout York Region supporting their social, emotional and spiritual wellbeing.

name: MCC Circles of Support & Accountability
description: Through Circles of Support and Accountability, teams of volunteers and staff, supported by professionals, meet with men and women with histories of sexual offending to hold them accountable for their actions and support them as they reintegrate into the community after release from prison.

name: Community Spaghetti Dinner
description: The Newmarket site organizes community spaghetti dinners open to the public

name: Frontline Outreach
description: The vision of Frontline Outreach is that every person who lives in poverty will be shown the love and mercy of God by the local church and all benefactors who provide housing, food, programs and opportunities that are gateways out of poverty. Their hope is that residents of every low income, subsidized housing community will be adopted by a caring and generous church, that results in breaking the cycle of poverty that affects the lives of so many children

name: Food for Life
description: Food for Life is an outreach program that provides neighbours in need with direct access to fresh food within their neighbourhood. The food is delivered by the refrigerated Food for Life truck.

name: Salvation Army Halton Lighthouse Shelter
description: The Salvation Army Halton Lighthouse provides emergency shelter, basic needs and intensive case management for men, and women who are homeless. The Lighthouse Shelter provides accommodation for 30 men and women who are experiencing homelessness and partners with the Canadian Mental Health SafePlace program for persons who have mental health crisis needs.

name: Kerr Street Mission
description: We partner with KSM's Neighbour Care Network which is committed to helping people in difficulty and distress with one-on-one support and encouragement.

name: Open Door
description: The Open Door at Square One is a front-line ministry outreach of the churches of Mississauga that has been ministering since 1974.  The Open Door serves people from every background and walk of life.

name: The Dam
description: The Dam partners with youth to create an inclusive community where all are welcomed, valued and respected.

name: Women's Habitat
description: Women's Habitat is a shelter and outreach centre that provides services and temporary housing for women in need to make a new life for themselves and their children.

name: RE:Soul
description: ReSoul is Milton's only youth dedicated drop-in centre, serving youth from grades 6-12.

name: Camp Connections
description: Camp Connections is a Christian summer camp that operates every July at Providence Point Retreat Center in Lanark, Ontario. We participate in two fundraising events annually: a bike trip from Ottawa to Montreal and the Pie Auction. And now about half of the staff at camp are Meeting Housers!

name: Restoring Hope Ministries
description: Restoring Hope provides spiritual, physical, and emotional support for youth experiencing homelessness. We make meals and lunches, volunteer on the frontline, offer financial support, and work as board and staff members.

name: Matthew House Ottawa
description: Since 2010, Matthew House Ottawa has welcomed hundreds of refugee claimants and provided quality used furniture to more than 5,000 families in need. We’re active and passionate supporters of this important ministry through prayer, volunteering, and donations of food and finances.

name: Safe Families Ottawa
description: Safe Families is a movement to keep children safe and families intact. We proudly serve as host families, family friends, family coaches, and resource friends. Together we volunteer to temporarily host children and provide a circle of support to families in crisis while they get back on their feet.

name: Jericho Road Christian Ministries
description: We have a history of working together at the Jericho Road Coffeehouse, where we serve marginalized, street-involved, and homeless individuals. Together we share in song, munchies, and a message. Volunteers have also helped organize office files and documents and supported Jericho Road though fundraising efforts like Coldest Night of the Year.

name: The Sound HUB
description: The Sound Hub is a collaborative partnership of community agencies, including the Parry Sound Non Profit Housing Corporation.  As a partner, The Meeting House Parry Sound is intentional in building relationships with the community members by organizing monthly meals, offering breakfast snacks on Sunday mornings, and partnering with neighbourhood initiatives

name: Spaghetti Dinners
description: Our site provides food, service, and a place to eat an affordable meal with members of our local community. We prepare and serve the food and set up the space to provide a welcoming environment for our diners.

name: Compassion 365
description: Compassion 365 provides food, toys, and clothing to those in need, as well as social justice awareness through documentaries and presentations. We've been able to support sorting of donation items as well as volunteering at social justice awareness events.

name: Fight4Freedom
description: Fight4Freedom is dedicated to battling human trafficking in the sex trade, seeing survivors set free, and giving beauty from ashes. We've been able to provide donation items to support outreach kits, and promote their work.

name: Glen Rhodes Community Dinners
description: Founded in 1906, Glen Rhodes United Church serves the East Toronto community through Sunday services, a monthly community dinner, and weekly food bank. The Glen Rhodes community seeks to be authentic disciples of Christ by offering hospitality to anyone who walks through their doors.

name: Mercy City Church
description: Mercy City serves the Dawes Road community of East Toronto. Their ministries include camps, after school programs, family nights, community dinners, and Sunday services with the goal of sharing the gospel and building relationships.

name: Red Door Family Shelter
description: The Red Door Family Shelter provides safe and supportive emergency housing to individuals and families in need of refuge from domestic violence and to those who find themselves without accommodation.

name: Yonge Street Mission
description: The Yonge Street Mission exists so that all the poor and vulnerable in Toronto that we encounter will experience God's love, peace, and justice at a level that represents the highest stewardship of the resources invested.

name: The Dale
description: The Dale creates a safe welcoming space in which all people, particularly the vulnerable and broken, are encouraged to participate fully, to the best of their abilities and journey together toward a deeper experience of the life God has given us.

name: Adam House
description: Adam House is a home and caring community for newly arrived refugee claimants in Toronto. They are a provider of immigration and settlement services and a non-profit Christian refugee reception centre that has to date supported over 2000 refugees, regardless of race, ethnicity or creed.

name: The Causeway
description: Causeway is a Christ-focused initiative of The Salvation Army. It is committed to living out the presence of Jesus Christ by intentionally connecting members of the local church with people who were recently homeless but are beginning a new life in a neighborhood. The purpose is to build unlikely yet mutually beneficial friendships.

name: The Sharing Place
description: The Sharing Place is a non-profit compassion organization that servers West Toronto with love and compassion.

name: Wesley Mimico United Church
description: Provides a community lunch every Saturday at 12PM and a food bank every Saturday (except the last in a month) between 11-1PM.

name: Inner City Outreach
description: Inner City Outreach provides wholistic programs for youth in the Jane and Finch community. Some programs they offer are homework clubs, a basketball league, Scouts, and camps.

name: Pregnancy Care Centre
description: The Pregnancy Care Centre provides personalized support and resources for women who are pregnant.

name: Matthew House
description: Matthew House's primary goal is to help restore refugees' dignity by providing shelter and support in a welcoming, home-like setting. Many refugees arrive with little more than a small bag and need practical support. We ensure that their individual needs are met and empower refugees to restart their lives in Canada.

name: Mennonite Coalition for Refugee Support
description: MCRS assists, accompanies, and advocates for refugee claimants in our community. We support their Welcome Home program by helping newly arrived individuals and families get settled — this includes helping them prepare for job interviews, supplying necessities, and being a source of connection to the wider community.

name: Adventure 4 Change
description: Adventure4Change addresses issues related to poverty and inequity for children, families, and youth by bringing together people committed to transformational change. As partners, we develop and foster meaningful relationships with the community to change and impact their lives and ours.

name: Peacebuilding
description: We are committed to non-violence, peacemaking, and being agents of reconciliation. We invest in peacebuilding because peace is the foundation for all other levels of development to be built on. We do this through pursuing Indigenous reconciliation, refugee sponsorship, restorative justice, relief, and peace literacy.
imagealt: A student sharing with his friends at a Peace Club in Zambia.

name: Poverty Alleviation
description: We aim to play a part in working against global poverty by partnering with two communities in Malawi: Mposa & Chamba. We’ve been walking with both communities since 2011 investing in education, childhood well-being, healthcare, economic development, and water and sanitation health.
imagealt: Young children in Jordan drawing and playing together inside a safe kids club that was created for them.

name: Global Church Partnerships
description: As a church, we recognize that we are one small part of the larger body of Christ. We partner with like-minded and under-resourced local churches in low to middle income countries in the areas of leadership development, theological development, evangelism, and the persecuted church.
imagealt: Group photo of BIC church leaders in Kenya, alongside Meeting House and BIC Canada team members.

name: Local Engagement
description: Parishes embed themselves into their communities to learn and listen to the unique opportunities that are present and then respond relationally and with humility. The result is a grassroots network of Jesus followers working for justice and building relationships with marginalized members of their community.
imagealt: A meeting house volunteer sorting and organizing donations as part of a local compassion initative.

name: St. John's the Evangelist
description: The London site partners with St. John's the Evanglist in serving hospitality meals on Saturday nights.

name: AVONA
description: AVONA provides safe places, shelter, support, counselling, and resources for abused women, their children, and all oppressed individuals to find a new start.

name: The Bridges
description: Cambridge Shelter Corporation expanded an “Out of the Cold” program that ran in local churches during winters and turned it into The Bridges, a facility that now includes a year round emergency shelter, a drop-in centre, and 20 affordable, transitional, bachelor apartments.  It is designed to offer a continuum of housing services, and to offer a wide variety of supporting programs to help clients address the issues facing them to move forward.

name: Cambridge Self Help Foodbank
description: The Cambridge Self-Help Food Bank offers food and support to people and community groups in need within Cambridge and North Dumfries. They encourage self-reliance through programs and services.

name: Eagles Nest Ministries
description: Eagles Nest offers counselling, support groups, and educational programs within the community. We promote their programs and services, regularly volunteer at fundraising events, and volunteer throughout the year.

name: Youth Unlimited PEC
description: Life for teens is different than 20 years ago, with technology and social media that bombard us with societal pressures day and night. PEC Youth Unlimited is there to help teens learn to live with a twinkle in their eye in this ever changing world. Our vision for PEC is to see Prince Edward County filled with vibrant youth who are being transformed by the Spirit of Jesus and who are committed to serving the community.

name: New Life Girls Home
description: To provide a safe place for young women with life-controlling problems to experience healing and transformation through a long-term Christian-based residential program.

name: Gilead Fellowship Church
description: Gilead Fellowship Church has provided a full Christmas Dinner for the past 20 years at noon on the 25th. This is open to anyone in the community who may not have anyone to spend Christmas with and the complete dinner and fellowship is provided at no cost.

name: West Lake Terrace Long Term Care Facility
description: To experience Hope, Purpose and Belonging in health care is the foundation of everything we strive for. It is reflected in our work, goals and motivation. In Hope, we find the promise of a brighter tomorrow. In Purpose, we give each day meaning by touching and changing the lives of others. And in Belonging, we share a sense of oneness, of community with our residents, staff and families.

name: Alliston Out of the Cold
description: Alliston Out of the Cold provides safe, respectful and welcoming accommodation for those encountering homelessness from November to April. They also organize community meals and facilitate connection to further services, resources, and community. The Meeting House Alliston partners with AOTC by volunteering for shifts, providing meals, hosting the community dinners, and extending community through our Sunday gathering and Home Church experience.

name: The Door Youth Centre
description: The Door Youth Centre acts as a community and support hub for youth aged 13 to 19. Through drop-in, lunch, and life skills programs, The Door seeks to be a place of support for at-risk teens and their families. The Meeting House Alliston financially supports the work of The Door and regularly partners with their strategic initiatives.

name: Indigenous & Settler Reconciliation:
description: We support Indigenous led and directed initiatives in the areas of clean water, food security, artisanship, and settler education.

name: Restorative Justice
description: An approach that comes alongside criminal offenders, victims, and communities, focusing on rehabilitation and reconciliation.
imagealt: A person closing a coffee cup in a cafe window

name: Peacebuilding in Sub-Saharan Africa
description: Developing peacebuilding skills and training for individuals and communities so they can navigate conflicts nonviolently.

name: Literacy & Education
description: We invest in inclusive and equitable quality education to ensure children have access to lifelong opportunities to impact their future.

name: Nutrition & Health
description: We invest in healthcare workers and institutions to improve the health of the communities and promote their well-being.
imagealt: A person closing a coffee cup in a cafe window

name: Water & Sanitation
description: We invest in the availability and sustainable management of water and property sanitation.

name: Livelihood: SDG 1
description: We invest in economic development and opportunities for communities to flourish.
imagealt: A person closing a coffee cup in a cafe window

name: Child Protection & Preventing early child marriage
description: We invest in gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls.
